3087BDF9529845A996CEE2A12CFA83B9.description: Partition rectangles into equal parts with equal area.

C49115777AE44385BEE0A6BBA69CEB40.description:
Partition shapes into b parts with equal areas. Express the area of each part as a unit fraction 1/b of the whole.
(Grade 3 expectations are limited to fractions with denominators b = 2,3,4,6,8.)

E5ECAE9080B1428EBE67DDA3C8B3CC35.description:
Understand that shapes in different categories (e.g., rhombuses, rectangles, and others)may share attributes
(e.g., having four sides), and that the shared attributes can define a larger category (e.g., quadrilaterals).
Recognize rhombuses, rectangles, and squares as examples of quadrilaterals, and draw examples quadrilaterals
that do not belong to any of these subcategories.

5375C0E6688B40BEB3282AE32FEAB3C5.description:
Reason with shapes and
their attributes.

2B51A3899F33494BB53D7C3203017DC2.description: Apply the formulas for area and perimeter to solve real world problems.

B8ED8EF157154D0AA01F174B64525464.description: Use addition to find the perimeter of a rectangle

8401DD26706149BE8889EC70136C6465.description: Identify a figure as getting larger or smaller when the dimensions of the figure changes

C358A051D31E4B36AADC0FECC02C252D.description:
Solve real-world and mathematical problems involving perimeters of plane figures and areas of rectangles,
including finding the perimeter given the side lengths, finding an unknown side length. Represent rectangles with
the same perimeter and different areas or with the same area and different perimeters.

FB16C163AA134D3F8A51AA2D64A06386.description: Apply the distributive property to solve problems with models.

5AC44D805C2D4DA1BE7D6EE75C760B4B.description: Apply the formulas for area and perimeter to solve real world problems.

D0A8A7E2A1CC44F2A366065D5D076CF8.description: Use tiling and multiplication to determine area.

48A791613FA64D29AB82A6A27CDE97D6.description: Use tiling and addition to determine area.

C06B58DEAC5A4F6DBA95732E347CD2FD.description:
Relate area to the operations of multiplication and addition.
a. Find the area of a rectangle with whole-number side lengths by tiling it, and show that the area is the same as
would be found by multiplying the side lengths.
b. Multiply side lengths to find areas of rectangles with whole-number side lengths in the context of solving realworld and mathematical problems, and represent whole-number products as rectangular areas in mathematical
reasoning.
c. Use tiling to show that the area of a rectangle with whole-number side lengths a and b + c is the sum of a × b
and a × c. Use area models to represent the distributive property in mathematical reasoning.
d. Understand that rectilinear figures can be decomposed into non-overlapping rectangles and that the sum of
the areas of these rectangles is identical to the area of the original rectilinear figure. Apply this technique to solve
problems in real-world contexts.

D139F8FBE68E432B9EA0727CC3C36E08.description: Measure area of rectangles by counting squares.

E5DFBC7DF23348ACA0E38050C0C11BD2.description: Measure areas by counting unit squares (e.g., square cm, square m, square in, square ft, and improvised units).

ED71A5644E204795B17F2946097F0CBB.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

4394C972132E451699B15D0DBD171FA2.description:
Understand area as an attribute of plane figures and understand concepts of area measurement.
a. A square with side length 1 unit, called “a unit square,” is said to have “one square unit” of area, and can be
used to measure area. b. A plane figure which can be covered without gaps or overlaps by n unit squares is said to have an area of n
square units.

CFE3D6858EE54F1CAF8ADA970EF21064.description:
Geometric measurement:
Understand concepts of area
and perimeter.

AB05AB4AE57445EAB22C0C245FA020A8.description: Organize measurement data into a line plot.

6E38F391DA4E459BBB08A004892B5CE5.description: Measure to solve problems using number lines and ruler to 1 inch, ½ inch, or ¼ of an inch.

9E33BA79FFF3408FAC355550D2159133.description:
Generate measurement data by measuring lengths using rulers marked with halves and
fourths of an inch.

856EAEBE6CDE480590B0AF86593686CD.description:
Generate measurement data by measuring lengths using rulers marked with halves and fourths of an inch to the
nearest quarter-inch. Show the data by making a line plot, where the horizontal scale is marked off in appropriate
units— whole numbers, halves, or quarters.

82DF871B52F44E0AB98F94E36D078704.description:
Select the appropriate statement that describes the data representations based on a given
graph (picture, bar, line plots).

161ECC444574499CA20DC141DEB31934.description: Collect data, organize into picture or bar graph.

89ECF2A4D8114172A50F0767B629A06B.description:
Create a scaled picture graph and a scaled bar graph to represent a data set with several categories. Solve oneand two-step "how many more" and "how many less" problems using information presented in scaled bar graphs.
See Table 1.

02894B27D51648318A1E10FB2C951E75.description: Select appropriate tool for measurement: liquid volume, area, time, money.

1B9DA5DC127B4F10ADC1FEC63BA1FD7B.description: Add to solve one step word problems.

B88D0457CE6542ACB45C7562AF101F14.description: Select appropriate units for measurement (liquid volume, area, time, money).

325D535907054B5EB6DA02D04640C514.description:
Measure and estimate liquid volumes and masses of objects using metric units. (Excludes compound units such as
cm3 and finding the geometric volume of a container.) Add, subtract, multiply, or divide to solve one-step word
problems involving masses or volumes that are given in the same units. Excludes multiplicative comparison
problems (problems involving notions of “times as much”). See Table 2.

CBD0FB1F1DDF4F8F8524D8243EE5AD13.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

D0B3E6B8F5754547AC123AC7134E0B57.description: Solve word problems involving money through $20.00, using symbols $, ".", ₵.

82A76E154AF1445A8D758DA4726E4C50.description:
Determine the equivalence between the number of minutes and the number of hours (e.g., 60 minutes
hour).

ED842933DF094103AF77435D7164AA5D.description:
Determine the equivalence between number of minutes and the fraction of the hour (e.g., 30 minutes =
hour).

2D159B14CEF54F6E937748084407FAF9.description:
Solve word problems involving the addition and subtraction of time intervals of whole hours or within
an hour (whole hours: 5:00 to 8:00, within hours: 7:15 to 7:45).

818CDD19DBBD4232B8C6D93B75F49041.description:
Tell and write time to the nearest minute and measure time intervals in minutes. Solve word problems involving
addition and subtraction of time intervals in minutes (e.g., representing the problem on a number line diagram).

E5F805EAE86C47B39A33A90589028D55.description:
Solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of fractions with like denominators
(2, 3, 4, or 8).

98467C32EA644FD0941F4B9505192B61.description: Use =, <, or > to compare 2 fractions with the same numerator or denominator.

AC4EA91DC4074DD494F18AD309A79615.description:
Explain equivalence of fractions in special cases, and compare fractions by reasoning about their size.
a. Understand two fractions as equivalent if they have the same relative size compared to 1 whole.
b. Recognize and generate simple equivalent fractions. Explain why the fractions are equivalent.
c. Express whole numbers as fractions, and recognize fractions that are equivalent to whole numbers.
d. Compare two fractions with the same numerator or the same denominator by reasoning about their size.
Understand that comparisons are valid only when the two fractions refer to the same whole. Record results of
comparisons with the symbols >, =, or <, and justify conclusions.

DBA6EFFFEBF9423692CB8657F88E06C3.description:
Identify the fraction that matches the representation (rectangles and circles; halves,
fourths, and thirds, eighths).

694D036CFD2E4CDFA933B0ACBF574B79.description:
Identify the total number of parts (denominator) of a given representation (rectangles and
circles).

05961DAA4F95477EB2F1574DBDA2748B.description:
Identify the number of highlighted parts (numerator) of a given representation (rectangles
and circles).

A8B93B2D21474E27A9857FD5C271DCA1.description: Order fractions on a number line.

2B3E403E9EAA4EA08D37B14822D7E8B4.description: Locate fractions on a number line.

FF410E8D1D064356A404B74224AED955.description: Locate given common unit fractions (i.e., ½, ¼, 1/8,) on a number line or ruler.

D8A6CBA5B1104A898642D8120728BF5A.description:
Identify that a part of a rectangle can be represented as a fraction that has a value
between 0 and 1.

8C43E57C283841F89785CF9CB99AFC86.description:
Understand a fraction as a number on the number line; represent fractions on a number line diagram.
a. Represent a fraction 1/b on a number line diagram by defining the interval from 0 to 1 as the whole and
partitioning it into b equal parts. Understand that each part has size 1/b and that the end point of the ased at 0
locates the number 1/b on the number line.
b. Represent a fraction a/b on a number line diagram by marking off a lengths 1/b from 0. Understand that the
resulting interval has size a/b and that its endpoint locates the number a/b on the number line including values
greater than 1. c. Understand a fraction 1/b as a special type of fraction that can be referred to as a unit fraction (e.g. 1/2, 1/4).

7EC18EE216F9426A832E54AD7066F33D.description:
Identify the fraction that matches the representation (rectangles and circles; halves,
fourths, and thirds, eighths).

C003AF436B3440F9A0761E086A8705F4.description:
Identify the total number of parts (denominator) of a given representation (rectangles and
circles).

3751115B2A584334A9F0D0382252B5F1.description:
Identify the number of highlighted parts (numerator) of a given representation (rectangles
and circles).

69ED2BDC600843B9BE6A37B941323F81.description:
Understand a fraction (1/b) as the quantity formed by one part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts;
understand a fraction a/b as the quantity formed by a parts of size 1/b.

5735F411CAD34E6882EDF7091412E82E.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

5D934C391C254B85BCD91A92128D91C0.description:
Multiply one-digit whole numbers by multiples of 10 in the range 10 to 90 using strategies based on place value
and the properties of operations (e.g., 9 x 80, 5 x 60).

BC38C307FBA643B19D2CCD5C8B911F90.description: Use the relationships between addition and subtraction to solve problems.

B9D600FC4E9D46308F59B2E0E7A70F6C.description: Solve multi-step addition and subtraction problems up to 100.

0BA82B061A7C4D0F98A91615B9C50C8F.description:
Fluently add and subtract within 1000 using strategies and algorithms based on place value, properties of
operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction.

67E660C040CB4BC9BA259C6AAD2BA701.description: Use rounding to solve word problems.

162B5EEEEB7B4C819E40AB23B732A75B.description: Use place value to round to the nearest 10 or 100.

63FBAE173E0645868DE3A61D030D6005.description: Use place value understanding to round whole numbers to the nearest 10 or 100.

A88D62008EE648BCA89229BC5989470D.description:
Use place value
understanding and
properties of operations to
perform multi-digit
arithmetic.

4A19CC723DB9472EB7C26A3034E2A866.description: Number and Operations in Base Ten

959F610BE4D04310982024E5CA928707.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

75F7086277BB455E9B7F4F77BA0778FF.description:
When solving problems, assess the reasonableness of answers using mental computation and estimation
strategies including rounding.

4C4F74F9281F49FCA9DF3DDB54220F6A.description: Identify multiplication patterns in a real word setting.

6BCD9E59DC134345A1A4595BC052CAEB.description:
Select or name the three next terms in a numerical pattern where numbers increase by 2,
5 or 10.

899EF897388F4B75B9B07524D4C51261.description: Describe the rule for a numerical pattern (e.g., increase by 2, 5, or 10).

3B07C506F2C64E3AB6D20F05DF677CC7.description:
Identify patterns in the addition table and the multiplication table and explain them using properties of
operations (e.g. observe that 4 times a number is always even, and explain why 4 times a number can be
decomposed into two equal addends).

9C7B33D44BD644E4BE896B90394D4339.description:
solve or solve and check one or two step word problems requiring addition, subtraction
or multiplication with answers up to 100.

EE6CD8E2EAB54AC08E8258B2E56C8933.description:
Solve two-step word problems using the four operations. Represent these problems using equations with a letter
standing for the unknown quantity. Utilize understanding of the Order of Operations when there are no
parentheses.

9053A1377FC64A3095117E384D7650BC.description:
Solve problems involving the
four operations, and identify
and explain patterns in
arithmetic.

E11B4FAF1A0F40C195F7635A5269E651.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

9D508F8848084C9E91404553C1A297DB.description:
Fluently multiply and divide within 100. By the end of Grade 3, know from memory all multiplication products
through 10 x 10 and division quotients when both the quotient and divisor are less than or equal to 10.

6F9F0C218DA34BD4990FAD6B2233EA8F.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

975E19D719E941F692B68000C5BDA43E.description:
Understand division as an unknown-factor problem (e.g., find 32 ÷ 8 by finding the number that makes 32 when
multiplied by 8).

69FDFD8E8B794FF6A76BBD5CBC1AD952.description: Apply properties of operations as strategies to multiply and divide.

5129294B184840B282211ACAE6BE82A6.description:
Apply properties of operations as strategies to multiply and divide. Properties include commutative and
associative properties of multiplication and the distributive property. (Students do not need to use the formal
terms for these properties.)

3955E799FBA04F6D894B5043F7AD81F9.description:
Understand properties of
multiplication and the
relationship between
multiplication and division.

F711C16AC7E94B43801E23C860E00C5F.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

3E7824F9A9724C2C9726A6E100322F73.description:
Determine the unknown whole number in a multiplication or division equation relating three whole numbers For
example, determine the unknown number that makes the equation true in each of the equations 8 x  = 48,
5 =  ÷ 3, 6 x 6 =  . See Table 2.

105547E3D13845F3BEA17014A06E3448.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

508EEA457BCE4AA4A90FEEC02CA557F4.description:
Use multiplication and division within 100 to solve word problems in situations involving equal groups, arrays,
and measurement quantities. See Table 2.

2D0E82E68BBA47179DC8C2A71BD39B7B.description:
Use objects to model multiplication and division situations involving up to 5 groups with
up to 5 objects in each group and interpret the results.

7670EBCCF7BC4B6BA2D93842E22D4882.description:
Determine the number of groups given the number of total number of objects and the
number of objects in each group where the number in each group and the number of groups
is not greater than 5.

26CAB30B11FF4A3F9D70E2863F5185C5.description:
Determine how many objects go into each group when given the total number of objects
and the number of groups where the number in each group or number of groups is not
greater than 5.

710E522C14994032911E6AB19B3F6FF3.description:
Interpret whole number quotients of whole numbers (e.g., interpret 56 ÷ 8 as the number of objects in each
group when 56 objects are partitioned equally into 8 groups, or as a number of groups when 56 objects are
partitioned into equal groups of 8 objects each). See Table 2.

F7AB71859E154417841C98FE1F6C8028.description:
Use objects to model multiplication and division situations involving up to 10 groups
with up to 5 objects in each group and interpret the results.

38FE85818E6E4EFEAF1E183737C88438.description: Match an accurate addition and multiplication equation to a representation.

31FAB4193F8E4553AD9D60758E29318D.description:
Find total number inside an array with neither number in the columns or rows larger than
10.

33C8279EACB64EFD84E01F9DE5F1C742.description:
Use objects to model multiplication and division situations involving up to 5 groups with
up to 5 objects in each group and interpret the results.

6C7828CB5EA749B88C36E7D8264292D0.description: Solve multiplication problems with neither number greater than 5.

2CADA779338748879EEE81EB2DBD1559.description:
Find total number inside an array with neither number in the columns or rows larger than
5.

E2225102D4934F4DADD302AC2522C778.description:
Find the total number of objects when given the number of identical groups and the
number of objects in each group neither number larger than 5.

C48637A16F704073A324D30A27B4BF6C.description:
Interpret products of whole numbers as the total number of objects in equal groups (e.g., interpret 5 x 7 as the
total number of objects in 5 groups of 7 objects each).

28C380256AAE4A4780D48C140B138098.description:
Represent and solve
problems involving whole
number multiplication and
division.
